result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason John Hauerwas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
*Defendant to pay balance due and owing to WCS Intoxicated Drivers Intervention Program.
*Defendant to pay fine, WCS balance, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing on July 1, 2016 and to continue on the first day of each month thereafter;  nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 15 days time served. With Huber release privileges for work.

*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason John Hauerwas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Sentence Modification signed and filed.  Copy sent to State and Defendant
Defendant's pro se request for early release from the House of Correction (sentence modification).
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this OWIPP .

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Julia C Westley.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work, consecutive with  any other sentence, with credit for 15 days time served.  

-Court ordered defendant pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge 
-Defendant to pay balance due and owing to WCS Intoxicated Drivers Intervention Program.
-Defendant to pay fine, WCS balance, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing on July 1, 2016 and to continue on the first day of each month thereafter;  nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant to obtain an AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 years
-Ignition interlock for 2 years.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Voter Ineligibility Notice and Acknowledgement
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report received and filed.

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Julia Westley.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendants requests another adjournment.  Court denies request for an adjournment and sets this matter for trial.  Court informed parties that Motions in Limine and Witness List to be filed on/before day of final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report received and filed.

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Julia Westley.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Matter scheduled for a "soft" plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report received and filed.

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Defendant expects to hire counsel.  Matter adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program report received and filed.

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Report, received and filed

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS report, received and filed

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Steven R. Kohn.  Danielle Chojnacki for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl Branch 19.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed, WCS Intoxicated Drive Report dated 8/10/2015

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared because WCS called the court this morning and reported that the defendant failed to appear yesterday afternoon as ordered. Later this morning, he came to WCS to be tested and tested negative. WCS brought him to Room 221, Out of Custody Court. Court Commissioner Sweet spoke to the defendant and ordered him to come back to Room 221 this afternoon at 1:30 pm to address the situation.
The defendant did come back this afternoon and Court Commissioner Sweet ordered the defendant to cooperate fully with WCS and to report to WCS immediately after court to report that he was seen by the commissioner this afternoon.

Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test. 
IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jason John Hauerwas in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter friend of the court.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
